title: Understanding Entropy
text: Entropy, in thermodynamics, is a measure of disorder or randomness in a system. When a system becomes more ordered or less random, the entropy decreases. Vice versa, when it becomes more disordered or more random, the entropy increases.

title: Compression of Gases
text: When a gas is compressed, the gas particles are forced into a smaller volume. This reduces the disorder or randomness of the system since the particles have less space to move around.

title: Think about Temperature
text: Consider what happens to the kinetic energy and movement of gas particles at a constant temperature. How does this affect entropy during compression?

title: Choosing the Sign
text: Given that compression reduces disorder in a gas, predict the direction of the entropy change.
